MAST.parsers.indeploopinputparser module¶

class MAST.parsers.indeploopinputparser.IndepLoopInputParser(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: MAST.utility.mastobj.MASTObj

Scans an input file for “indeploop” keyword and copies it into many input files. Attributes:

self.indeploop <str>: flag for independent looping self.loop_delim <str>: character for delimiting loops self.loop_start <str>: character indicating start of loop self.loop_end <str>: character indicating end of loop self.baseinput <MASTFile>: MASTFile created from *.inp input file self.pegloop1 <str>: flag for one pegged loop self.pegloop2 <str>: flag for second pegged loop

Looping must be indicated at the beginning of the line, and the text to be looped must be complete: indeploop mast_kpoints (3x3x3 G, 5x5x5 G, 2x2x2 M, 4x4x4 M)

combine_combo_lists(indeplist, peggedlist)[source]¶

Combine combination lists. Args:

indeplist <list of list>: List of indeploop combinations. peggedlist <list of list>: List of pegged loop combinations
Returns:
alllist <list of list>: List of all combinations
combine_three_combo_lists(indeplist, peglist1, peglist2)[source]¶

Combine two pegged lists and one independent list. Args:

indeplist <list of list>: List of indeploop combinations. peglist1 <list of list>: List of pegged loop 1 combinations peglist2 <list of list>: List of pegged loop 2 combinations
Returns:
alllist <list of list>: List of all combinations
create_input_files(datasets_dict)[source]¶

Create independently looped input files. Args:

datasets_dict <dict of list>
Returns:
createdfiles <list of str>: list of newly-created file names

Creates an input file for each entry.

Prepare a combination list of looping indices. Args:

scan_for_loop
Returns:

representing combinations

Scan for independent loops and set up dictionaries. Return:

createdfiles <list of str>: list of created input files

Prepare looped datasets from looping lines. Args:

alldict <dict>: line dictionary for looping allcombs <list of list>: index combinations for looping
Returns:
datasets_dict <dict of list>: full datasets for new input files

Prepare looped lines from looping dictionary. Args:

loopdict <dict>: dictionary of looping items from
scan_for_loop
Returns:
loopline_dict <dict of dict>: dictionary of different lines for
input files, with keys being the looped line index
print_list(mylist)[source]¶

Print a list. Args:

mylist <list of str>
scan_for_loop(loopkey)[source]¶

Scan for loops. Args:

loopkey <str>: string for searching for loops. This is
either “indeploop” or “pegloop”
Return:
loopdict <dict>: Dictionary where loop line indices in the file
are keys, with values ‘looplist’, containing a list of strings, and ‘prepend’, containing any text to prepend ‘append’, containing any text to append
e.g. loopdict[12][‘looplist’]=[‘3x3x3 G’,‘5x5x5 G’]
[‘prepend’]=’mast_kpoints ‘ [‘append’]=’‘
